= Including Firewater as a Maven dependency =

The latest Firewater SNAPSHOT build is easily accessed using [http://maven.apache.org/download.html Maven2].  You will need to include a <repository> tag in your pom.xml file (or your ~/.m2/settings.xml file) as well as a <dependency> tag for including Firewater:

*Note the latest release is v0.9.1 and the latest snapshot is v0.9.2-SNAPSHOT*

{{{
<project ....>
  <build>
    ...
  </build>

  <repositories>
    <repository>
      <id>google-code-firewater-repo</id>
      <name>Firewater Maven Repo</name>
      <url>http://firewaterframework.googlecode.com/svn/repo</url>
    </repository>
  </repositories>

  <dependencies>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.firewaterframework</groupId>
      <artifactId>firewater</artifactId>
      <version>0.9.1</version>      
      <!--<version>0.9.2-SNAPSHOT</version>-->
    </dependency>
    ...
  </dependencies>
</project>
}}}
